intro: Pleurospermum franchetianum, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
